Dear Tyler Jones:
Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. Due to the
violations identified in the report, a written corrective action plan is required. The
corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and must include the
following:
• How compliance with each rule will be achieved.
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result
in compliance.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
violation.
• Specific time frames for each violation as to when the action steps will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you desire technical assistance in addressing these issues, please feel free to contact
me. In any event, the corrective action plan is due within 15 days. Failure to submit an
acceptable corrective action plan will result in disciplinary action.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager at (517) 243-9743.

III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4158 Intervention standards and prohibitions
Section (1) A child caring institution shall establish and follow written
Description policies and procedures that prohibit the following forms of
intervention:
(a) Any type of physical punishment including, but not
limited to:
1

(ii) Hitting or striking, throwing, kicking, pulling, or
pushing a youth on any part of their body.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Staff 2 assaulted Youth A multiple times in the parking lot of the
facility.
Investigation
Interviews:
On 1/24/2024, I contacted DHHS Worker 1 and discussed the
allegations. According to DHHS Worker 1, police had interviewed
Staff 2 and the agency had terminated Staff 2 from employment.
DHHS Worker 1 reported on call worker completed interview with
youth.
On 1/24/2024, I spoke to Administrator 1 and discussed the
allegations, documents, and scheduling of interviews. No
additional information was provided.
On 1/25/2024, I spoke to Complainant 1. No additional
information was provided.
The following interviews were completed face to face on
1/29/2024 at the facility:
Supervisor 1:
Supervisor 1 reported she was the supervisor on duty on
1/20/2024. Supervisor 1 reported there were three youth and two
staff in the “Letts” house where the incident stemmed from.
Supervisor 1 reported that on weekends, they sometimes have to
fill shifts due to staff calling off and, on this day, they had Staff 2
come in to fill a shift. Supervisor 1 reported Staff 2 was a normal
third shift worker. Supervisor 1 reported at the beginning of the
shift, she took Staff 2 aside and went over his “purple training
sheets.” Staff 2 was fairly new and had never worked an afternoon
shift. Supervisor 1 reported she went over how to address the
youth, telling him to redirect when needed but not to be
aggressive in that redirection. Supervisor 1 did meet with the other
staff working with Staff 2. Supervisor 1 reported she spoke to Staff
3, directing her to train Staff 2. Supervisor 1 reported Staff 2 did
not yet have a set of keys of his own because he had not been
employed for three months. Supervisor 1 reported at three months
staff receive keys. This meant he was to observe, learn and follow
the lead staff on duty in the unit. At approximately 5:00pm/5:30pm,
Supervisor 1 reported she was called on the radio to assist at the
2

“Letts” house. Supervisor 1 reported when she entered the unit,
Youth A had flipped a desk and was loud with Staff 2. Supervisor
1 reported she immediately attempted to deescalate Youth A.
Youth A went to his door and Staff 2 followed him in what
appeared to be challenging Youth A to a physical altercation.
Youth A shut his door, Supervisor 1 went to the door and Staff 2
backed away from the door. Supervisor 1 opened the door
attempting to talk to Youth A, then Youth A began threatening and
cussing at Staff 2. Staff 2 then started cussing at him. At one point
Youth A threatened to fight Staff 2 and Staff 2 replied with, “Lets
get it going.” Supervisor 1 called for backup in the house and Staff
1 came in. Staff 2 went into the staff office with Staff 3. Staff 2 was
still taunting Youth A through the office window, making gestures
with his arms wide open as if welcoming a physical altercation.
Supervisor 1 reported she told Staff 2 he had to leave and go
home. Youth A attempted to get into the office but was unable to.
Supervisor 1 and Staff 1 were able to remove the three youth,
Youth A, Youth B and Youth C from the house to go to the gym
building. (It should be noted the two other youth were not involved
in the incident and did stay out of the situation.) As they were
walking in the hallway of the gym, Youth A saw Staff 2 in the
parking lot getting ready to leave and ran out of the gym after him.
Supervisor 1 and Staff 1 left the other two youth with other staff
and followed Youth A into the parking lot. Supervisor 1 reported
he and Staff 1 attempted many times to get Staff 2 to leave the
premises, but he would not listen. Supervisor 1 reported they were
attempting to deescalate Youth A by physically holding him back.
Staff 2 had stated, “Are you gonna let those hoes hold you back?”
Youth A got through Staff 1 and both Staff 2 and Youth A began
hitting each other with closed fists. Both Supervisor 1 and Staff 1
attempted to break them up. Staff 2 was able to “throw” Staff 1 out
of his way, causing her to smack her head on the pavement. Staff
3 then came out of the house and helped Staff 1. Staff 2 and
Youth A began to fight again. Staff 2 then went to his car as if to
get in, then stopped and said, “You are going to be scared when I
get this out of my trunk.” Staff 2 attempted to open his trunk and at
this time, Supervisor 1 reported she told Youth A to go, and he
listened. Supervisor 1 reported it seemed like he was trying to tell
them he had a gun in his car but didn’t know for sure. Staff 2 was
unable to open his trunk and then went into his car and started to
drive away. He then stopped in the parking lot for a while, and
then left. Supervisor 1 reported Staff 3 had contacted the police
before she had come out into the parking lot to help Staff 1.
Supervisor 1 reported after the incident she processed the events
with the youth and checked for injuries on Youth A. Supervisor 1
sent Youth A to the Eaton Rapids Medical to make sure he was
3

ok. Supervisor 1 reported at the end of her shift she talked to all
staff and was overall pleased with how they handled themselves
in this situation.
Staff 3 was not in the parking lot; therefore, did not witness the
events in the parking lot.
Staff 1:
Staff 1 reported she was working the afternoon shift on 1/20/2024
and heard a radio call for assistance. Staff 1 reported she went to
the “Letts” house to help and saw Youth A yelling at Staff 2. Staff
3 took Staff 2 in the staff office. Staff 1 reported Staff 2 had called
the kids “bitches” and the female staff in the unit “hoes”. Staff 1
reported Staff 2 had threatened Youth A by stating, “fight me,
show me what you got.” Staff 1 reported Supervisor 1 and herself
took the three youth outside of the house and went to the gym.
Staff 1 reported Youth A ran out of the gym after Staff 2, who was
now in the parking lot. Staff 2 had used profanity towards Youth A
and Youth A and Staff 2 began fist fighting each other. Staff 1
reported she and Supervisor 1 attempted to separate Staff 2 and
Youth A and was able to, but Staff 2 threw Staff 1 and she landed
on her back and head. Staff 1 reported she had lost
consciousness for a minute, but when she was able to focus, Staff
2 was still there, and Staff 3 was helping her. Staff 1 reported Staff
3 had called the police. Staff 1 was unable to provide any more
information after she had been helped by Staff 3.
Youth A:
Youth A reported Staff 3 and Staff 2 were working the afternoon
shift on 1/20/2024. Youth A reported Staff 2 was antagonizing the
three youth by telling them they were going to lose their points for
the day for no reason. Youth A reported he was getting upset so
he asked to go into his room. Youth A went into his room and Staff
2 followed him. Youth A shut the door and he heard Staff 3 tell
Staff 2 to “give him space.” Staff 2 then stated, “these boys need a
man to discipline them.” Youth A came out of his room and
reported he started arguing with Staff 2 and challenged him to
fight. Youth A reported Staff 3 took Staff 2 in the office, and all
three youth went outside with Supervisor 1 and Staff 1. Youth A
stated they went to the gym and then he saw Staff 2 outside, so
he ran after him. They both began arguing back and forth and
Staff 2 and Youth A began fighting with closed fists. Youth A
reported he was hit by Staff 2 on his right jaw line and right
shoulder. Youth A reported Staff 2 also hit Staff 1. After he hit
Staff 1, Youth A reported he went after Staff 2 again and they
were hitting each other. Youth A reported he was calling the staff,
4

“hoes” and “bitches”. Youth A reported when they stopped, Staff 2
made a comment about getting something out of his trunk, as if
telling them he had a gun in his car. Youth A did not know this for
sure but this was what Youth A thought Staff 2 meant. Supervisor
1, Staff 2, and Youth A left the area. Youth A reported Supervisor
1 and Staff 1 were attempting to deescalate the situation. Youth A
reported his finger hurt and he did receive medical care. Youth A
reported he has talked to his mother and his therapist about the
incident.
An attempt to contact Staff 2 was made on 2/5/2024. He declined
to speak to DHHS Worker 1 and this consultant.
Video Footage:
I reviewed video footage from 5:35pm-6:04pm in the house. There
is no video footage outside in the parking lot. Youth A was
aggressive in the video and attempting to go after Staff 2 who was
in the office. Supervisor 1 and Staff 1 were attempting to hold
back Youth A but were unable to put him in a Non-Violent Crisis
Intervention hold, although they did attempt. Youth A took his shirt
off and attempted to go into the office. He flipped a couch over
and pushed staff out of his way multiple times.
After watching the video, I interviewed Administrator 1 concerning
the behavior of Youth A. Administrator 1 reported Youth A has
been known to get physically aggressive if he does not get his
way.
Documents Reviewed:
• Incident Report completed 1/21/2024 at 12:01am. The
incident date is for 1/20/2024. The incident report is in
accordance with the interviews completed.
• Eaton Rapids Medical Center Report dated 1/20/2024 for
Youth A; diagnosis, finger and wrist sprain.
• Personnel File of Staff 2. Staff 2 was hired on 11/29/2023
as a “Part-Time Overnight Worker.” All clearances were
completed, and training completed as outlined in Licensing
Rules for Child Caring Institutions. Staff 2 completed 31.5
hours of training and completed training on Non-Violent
Crisis Intervention (NCVI) on 12/16/2023.
• Ingham County Sherrif Departments Police Report. At
this time, charges are pending.
Analysis Staff 2 physically assaulted Youth A. Supervisor 1, Staff 1, and
Youth A all confirmed a physical assault between Youth A and
Staff 2.
5

TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE: I reviewed Staff 2’s Job Description
Details signed by him. Staff 2 was hired specifically as an
“Overnight Worker” with a “Decision Making” level at a “low level,
2 on a 10 point scale.” Staff 2 was hired to monitor youth at
overnight hours and the success in completing that job is based
on the ability to, “supervise an assigned house or campus during
overnight hours, familiar with and practice current agency
policies…take necessary precautions for students identified as
high risk and provide oversight of them as prescribed…maintain
good communication with day staff through exchange of relevant
information…maintain alert and close supervision of students until
properly relieved by regularly assigned staff…”
Staff 2 was specifically hired to work overnight hours.
Administrator 1 did report that, afternoon direct care workers have
a different job description. Administrator 1 reported they do use
overnight workers in afternoon shifts at times. Administrator 1
reported this is how they promote from within as well. Staff 2 does
not have an afternoon direct care job description in his file. The
agency allowed an overnight worker to fill a role that he was not
hired for. If the agency would like to permit overnight workers to
work afternoon shifts, then the agency will need to update their
“Overnight Worker Job Description” to align with those
responsibilities and decision making skills or consider creating one
universal Direct Care Worker Job Description, expecting all direct
care staff to function at the same abilities.
Conclusion Violation Established
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4158 Interventions and Prohibitions
Section (1) A child caring institution shall establish and follow written
Description policies and procedures that prohibit the following forms of
intervention:
(a) Any type of physical punishment including, but not
limited to:
(iv)Verbal abuse including the use of derogatory or
discriminatory language including negative references to a
youth’s background or appearance or mental state. Yelling,
threats, ridicule, or humiliation are strictly prohibited.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Staff 1 verbally threatened Youth A multiple times in the facility
and in the parking lot of the facility.
6

Investigation
Interviews:
Supervisor 1:
Supervisor 1 reported she witnessed Staff 2 cussing at Youth A
when she entered the unit on the day of the incident. At one point
Youth A threatened to fight Staff 2 and Staff 2 replied with, “Lets
get it going.” Supervisor 1 called for backup in the house and Staff
1 came in. Staff 2 went into the staff office with Staff 3. Staff 2 was
still taunting Youth A through the office window, making gestures
with open arms as if welcoming a physical altercation. Once
outside on the parking lot, Supervisor 1 reported she and Staff 1
attempted many times to get Staff 2 to leave the premises, but he
would not listen. Supervisor 1 reported she and Staff 1 were
attempting to deescalate Youth A by physically holding him back.
Staff 2 had stated, “Are you gonna let those hoes hold you back?”
At one point, Staff 2 then went to his car as if to get in, then
stopped and said, “You are going to be scared when I get this out
of my trunk.” Staff 2 attempted to open his trunk and at this time,
Supervisor 1 reported she told Youth A to go, and he listened.
Supervisor 1 reported it seemed like he was trying to tell them he
had a gun in his car but didn’t know for sure.
Staff 1:
Staff 1 reported when she was in the house attempting to help,
Staff 2 was calling the kids “bitches” and the female staff in the
unit “hoes”. Staff 1 reported Staff 2 was also threatening Youth A
by stating, “fight me, show me what you got.” Staff 1 reported Staff
2 was using profanity when talking to the youth in the house.
Youth A:
Youth A reported when they were in the house, Youth A shut the
door and he heard Staff 3 tell Staff 2 to “give him space.” Staff 2
then stated, “these boys need a man to discipline them.” Once
they were outside in the parking lot, Youth A reported they had
stopped fighting and then Staff 2 made a comment about getting
something out of his trunk, so staff and Youth A left the area.
Analysis Supervisor 1, Staff 1, and Youth A all reported Staff 2 made verbal
threats and threatening gestures towards staff and Youth A. Staff
2 made derogatory comments towards the staff on site and
challenged Youth A to a physical fight.
Conclusion Violation Established
7

IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it
is recommended that the current license status be continued.
